*div1 type="summary"* *p*Asks concerning method of holding his claims*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Woodville*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-27-1825">27th Sept. 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*I have now made my arrangements to send two or three *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*to your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*some time in the *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1825">winter*/date_mentioned*, to make a Crop *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1826">next year*/date_mentioned*, but I find it impracticable for me to move my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*for several years, therefore I write this particularly to know from you, if I am there myself and make a Crop, will it be sufficient to hold my land, with the title I already have. I am anxious you would write to me by the *date_mentioned n="11-01-1825">first of November*/date_mentioned* on this subject—if you think this will not answer I will probably decline the undertaking.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm. P. Perkins*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Give my respects to *person_mentioned*Coln Pettis*/person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Mr. Williams*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Coln Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Doctr Kennady*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
